verses.roman:
e-saba pramāṇe jāni nityānanda-tattva-sīmā
tāṅhāke 'ananta' kahi, ki tāṅra mahimā

synonyms: e-saba—all these; pramāṇe—by the evidences; jāni—I know; nityānanda-tattva-sīmā—the limit of the truth of Lord Nityānanda; tāṅhāke—to Him (Lord Nityānanda, Balarāma); ananta—Lord Ananta; kahi—if I say; ki tāṅre mahimā—what glory do I speak about Him.
translation: From these conclusions we can know the limit of the truth of Lord Nityānanda. But what glory is there in calling Him Ananta?
